lines.content: * Represents a task with a deadline.

* @param description The description of the task.
* @param byDate      The deadline date of the task.

* @return The formatted description with the deadline date.
* Formats the given LocalDate object into a string.
* @param date The LocalDate object to format.
* Converts the DeadlineTask object to a string in save format.
* @return The string representation of the task in save format.
* The main class of the Firefly task management application.
* Allows users to interact with the application through a command-line interface.
* The main method of the application.
* Creates a Scanner object to read user input and initializes the task list.
* Displays the logo and welcomes the user.
* Handles user commands and interacts with the TaskListHandler and DukeExceptionHandler classes.
System.out.println("Type help to view all commands!");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
EventTask eventTask = new EventTask(eventInfo[0], startDate, endDate, isOnce);
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("No tasks found with the keyword: " + keyword);
System.out.println("Here is a list of valid commands:");
System.out.println("mark     - Marks a task as completed");
System.out.println("unmark   - Removes a mark from a task");
System.out.println("find     - Finds tasks with a specific keyword");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Handles exceptions for Duke commands to ensure proper user input format.
* Handles exceptions for Duke commands based on the user input and the task list.
* @throws DukeException If the user input does not meet the required format for the command.
public static void handleExceptions(String userInput, List<Task> taskList) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Please follow the following format: todo <description>");
throw new DukeException("Please follow the following format: deadline <description> /by <date>");
throw new DukeException("Deadline description cannot be empty. Please follow the format: deadline <description> /by <date>");
throw new DukeException("Invalid date format. Please use dd-MM-yyyy for the deadline.");
throw new DukeException("Please follow the following format: event <description> /from <start date> /to <end date> [/once]");
throw new DukeException("Event description, start date, and end date cannot be empty. Please follow the format: event <description> /from <start date> /to <end date> [/once]");
throw new DukeException("Invalid date format. Please use dd-MM-yyyy for the event dates.");
throw new DukeException("Please follow the following format: mark <task number>");
throw new DukeException("Task number is out of range.");
throw new DukeException("Please enter a number value.");
throw new DukeException("Please follow the following format: unmark <task number>");
throw new DukeException("Task number is out of range.");
throw new DukeException("Please enter a number value.");
throw new DukeException("Please follow the following format: delete <task number>");
throw new DukeException("Task number is out of range.");
throw new DukeException("Please enter a number value.");
throw new DukeException("Please enter a valid command.");
* Represents an event task with a start date, end date, and optional "once within period" flag.
* Constructs an EventTask object with the given description, start date, end date, and "once within period" flag.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param fromDate    The start date of the event task.
* @param toDate      The end date of the event task.
* @param isOnce      True if the event occurs only once within the period, false otherwise.
public EventTask(String description, LocalDate fromDate, LocalDate toDate, boolean isOnce) {
* Gets the description of the event task along with its start and end dates.
* @return The formatted description with the start and end dates, and "once within period" info if applicable.
return super.getDescription() + " (from: " + formatDate(fromDate) + " to: " + formatDate(toDate) + ")" + onceInfo;
* Converts the EventTask object to a string in save format.

* Represents a task with a type, description, and completion status.

* Marks the task as not done.

System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
